meanings.definition: An unpredictable or erratic action, occurrence, or idea.
meanings.sent1: The vagaries of the weather made planning a picnic impossible.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the vagaries of her favorite TV show, never knowing what would happen next.
meanings.sent3: The vagaries of the cat's behavior always kept the family entertained.
meanings.sent4: Life's vagaries can sometimes lead us down unexpected paths.
meanings.sent5: Navigating the vagaries of the stock market requires careful attention.

meanings.definition: Whimsical or eccentric behavior or actions.
meanings.sent1: Her artistic vagaries often left her friends puzzled but amused.
meanings.sent2: The clown's vagaries entertained the children at the birthday party.
meanings.sent3: The vagaries of the fashion designer's latest collection raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: His vagaries in decorating the office made it a unique and fun place to work.
meanings.sent5: The writer's vagaries in storytelling captivated readers of all ages.
